org.microbean.jersey.container.grizzly2.http.cdi

Class Producers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.jersey.container.grizzly2.http.cdi.Producers

  • @ApplicationScoped
class Producers
extends Object
    A class housing producer methods that manufacture certain Grizzly- and Jersey-related objects, including HttpServer instances (by way of GrizzlyHttpServerFactory instances) and GrizzlyHttpContainer instances (by way of ContainerFactory instances).

    For this class to be useful, a CDI container must be capable of locating or otherwise supplying SSLEngineConfigurator instances. See the MicroBean Grizzly HTTP Server CDI Integration project for an example of a project that supplies such instances.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson

    • Method Detail

      • produceGrizzlyHttpContainer

        @Produces
 @Dependent
private static final org.glassfish.jersey.grizzly2.httpserver.GrizzlyHttpContainer produceGrizzlyHttpContainer(Instance<Application> applicationInstance)
        Creates and returns a new GrizzlyHttpContainer if the supplied Instance containing Application instances is not unsatisfied.

        This method may return null.

        Parameters:
        applicationInstance - an Instance housing an Application; may be null
        Returns:
        a GrizzlyHttpContainer, or null
        See Also:
        ContainerFactory.createContainer(Class, Application)

      • produceHttpServer

        @Produces
 @Dependent
private static final org.glassfish.grizzly.http.server.HttpServer produceHttpServer(@ConfigurationValue(value="host",defaultValue="0.0.0.0")
                                                                                                          String host,
                                                                                                          @ConfigurationValue(value="port",defaultValue="8080")
                                                                                                          int port,
                                                                                                          @ConfigurationValue(value="contextPath")
                                                                                                          String contextPath,
                                                                                                          Instance<org.glassfish.jersey.grizzly2.httpserver.GrizzlyHttpContainer> containerInstance,
                                                                                                          @ConfigurationValue(value="secure")
                                                                                                          boolean secure,
                                                                                                          Instance<org.glassfish.grizzly.ssl.SSLEngineConfigurator> sslEngineConfiguratorInstance)
        Creates and returns a new HttpServer if the supplied Instance containing a GrizzlyHttpContainer is non-null and not unsatisfied.

        This method may return null.

        Note that the the supplied Instance containing a GrizzlyHttpContainer may be non-null and not unsatisfied and yet may still produce a null GrizzlyHttpContainer. In this case, a suitable warning will be logged, but HttpServer creation will proceed anyways.

        Parameters:
        host - the address of the network interface to listen on; may be null in which case 0.0.0.0 will be used instead
        port - the port to listen on; 8080 by default
        contextPath - where the resulting web application should be rooted; may be null in which case / will be used instead
        containerInstance - an Instance housing a GrizzlyHttpContainer instance (such as might be produced by the produceGrizzlyHttpContainer(Instance) method); may be null or unsatisfied in which case null will be returned
        secure - whether the communication with the server will be secure or not
        sslEngineConfiguratorInstance - an Instance housing an SSLEngineConfigurator; may be null or unsatisfied in which case an SSLEngineConfigurator instance will not be passed to the GrizzlyHttpServerFactory.createHttpServer(URI, GrizzlyHttpContainer, boolean, SSLEngineConfigurator, boolean) method
        Returns:
        an HttpServer, or null
        See Also:
        produceGrizzlyHttpContainer(Instance), Issue #1, GrizzlyHttpContainer, GrizzlyHttpServerFactory.createHttpServer(URI, GrizzlyHttpContainer, boolean, SSLEngineConfigurator, boolean)
